channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New Orleans musicians share their favorite Christmas songs, from bounce to blues
item.description: Rosemary Westwood from member station WWNO asked a few of New Orlean's favorite musicians about the songs they like to listen to around Christmas.

item.title: Shopping for pricy ACA health plans? Some cheaper options come with trade-offs
item.description: Without a fix from Congress, costs for many people who buy health care on the Affordable Care Act marketplace have gone up. Here's what's to know abou...

item.title: On winter's coldest days, this classic Kashmiri coat offers warmth — and wisdom
item.description: In Kashmir, December 21 is said to mark the start of the 40 harshest days of winter. A woolen robe called a pheran is key to keeping warm — and a remi...

item.title: A radio station in Amsterdam is a lifeline for Sudan. After USAID cuts, it's faltering
item.description: Budget cuts threaten the future of Amsterdam-based Radio Dabanga, which has served as an information lifeline for Sudanese people about their war-torn...

item.title: Cartagena's iconic horse carriages give way to electric buggies
item.description: Cartagena, Colombia, is set to ban its iconic horse-drawn carriages, replacing them with electric buggies — a move dividing the historic city over tra...

item.title: 12/21: Face The Nation
item.description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Republican Rep. Thomas Massie and Democratic Rep. Ro Khanna join to discuss the newest batch of ...

item.title: Israel approves 19 new settlements in occupied West Bank
item.description: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.

item.title: Top Trump administration official defends partial release of Epstein files as Democrats cry foul
item.description: Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche is defending the Justice Department’s decision to release just a fraction of the Jeffrey Epstein files by the con...

item.title: Thousands gather for winter solstice celebrations at Stonehenge
item.description: Many make the pilgrimage to the stone circle every summer and winter and consider it a spiritual experience.

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard pursuing third oil tanker off Venezuela coast, source says
item.description: The pursuit of the tanker, off the coast of Venezuela, is the second such operation this weekend and the third in less than a week.

item.title: At least 15 newly-released Epstein files have disappeared from DOJ's website, records show
item.description: The episode has deepened concerns that had already emerged from the Justice Department's much-anticipated document release.

item.title: Gunmen kill nine in South Africa tavern attack
item.description: A further 10 people were injured in Bekkersdal after the perpetrators opened fire and "continued to shoot randomly".

item.title: Who and what are in the Epstein files?
item.description: High-profile figures, including Bill Clinton and Michael Jackson, can be seen in the long-awaited files.

item.title: Power restored to about 113,000 San Francisco customers after widespread outage
item.description: PG&E said it did not have a precise timeframe for when power would be fully restored due to the "significant and extensive" damage to one of its subst...

item.title: US seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela's coast
item.description: The move comes after US President Donald Trump ordered a "blockade" of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

item.title: Rights groups condemn new record number of executions in Saudi Arabia
item.description: At least 347 people have now been put to death this year, according to the UK-based campaign group Reprieve.

item.title: Muddy eruption at Yellowstone’s Black Diamond Pool captured on video
A brief encounter, two attacks and then a break in investigations into the Brown and MIT shootings
